hero.title: ‘Broken from start’, UniTeam sees complete collapse
hero.description: Manila, Philippines — While it felt real, especially for millions of Filipinos who brought Ferdinand Marcos Jr. and Sara Duterte to the presidency and vice presidency, the UniTeam, which Sen. Imee Marcos had described as “marriage made in heaven,” was after all just an illusion.

primary.lead: President Marcos Jr. Signs 6.3 Trillion 2025 Budget
primary.title: Why the Philippines’ latest budget has been called ‘heartbreaking’
primary.description: Funds for the social and health protection of the country’s poorest have been channelled to politicians for their pet projects, critics say.

secondary.title: Marcos vetoes P194 billion worth of line items in 2025 national budget
secondary.description: (President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. says the vetoed line items, including P26 billion worth of projects under the Department of Public Works and Highways, are 'inconsistent' with his administration's priorities

secondary.title: Marcos signs 2025 national budget; vetoes P194-B items
secondary.description: After much controversy, President Marcos signed the 2025 national budget on Monday, Dec. 30, disclosing that he vetoed P194 billion worth of line items.

secondary.title: PBBM trims 2025 budget to P6.32 Trillion
secondary.description: Vetoes P194-b line items, keeps AKAP President Ferdinand “Bongbong” Marcos Jr. signed the P6.326-trillion General Appropriations Act (GAA) for 2025

carousel.title: 340 New Year revelers welcome 2025 injured
carousel.description: Three hundred forty individuals welcomed 2025 with injuries caused by firecrackers and fireworks, according to the Department of Health (DOH).

carousel.title: At least P2.5-B Villar-led ‘flood control’ project in Las Piñas City fails to solve flooding
carousel.description: What you need to know: Sacks of charcoal reached the roof of a cramped space inside the Old Zapote Market in Las Piñas City. Black dust settled on Mary’s skin, as she supervised the workers hauling the sacks in a delivery truck.

carousel.title: NAIA breaks passenger record with 50 million travelers in 2024
carousel.description: Passenger traffic at Ninoy Aquino International Airport reached 50.1 million in 2024, breaking all previous records as travel demand surged past pre-pandemic levels.

carousel.title: Navy investigates origin, purpose of underwater drone recovered in Masbate
carousel.description: The drone was marked HY-119, which reportedly refers to a Chinese underwater navigation and communication system.
